newsData.title: با درگیری بی c c cسابقه و تنش c c cزای ۱۲ روزه میان اسرائیل و ایران که با حملات موشکی متقابل، خسارات گسترده زیرساختی و تعطیلی c c cهای سراسری در سرزمین c c cهای اشغالی همراه بود، مقامات اقتصادی اسرائیل از یک ضربه بی c c cسابقه به پیکر اقتصاد سخن می cگویند.

newsData.title: جنگ ۱۲ روزه میان ایران و اسرائیل، چالش cهای اقتصادی کسب cو cکارها و خانوارها را بیش از پیش تشدید کرده است.

newsData.title: در شرایط بحرانی مانند تنش cهای ژئوپلیتیک، اولویت اصلی در رویکرد اقتصادی دولت cها باید حمایت از خانوارها و بنگاه cها باشد، حتی اگر این حمایت منجر به افزایش کسری بودجه یا رشد پایه پولی شود.
newsData.summary: در شرایط بحرانی، دولت‌ها باید از خانوارها و بنگاه‌ها حمایت کنند، حتی اگر منجر به افزایش کسری بودجه شود، و تامین مالی کسری بودجه می‌تواند از طریق افزایش مالیات، استقراض یا افزایش پایه پولی انجام شود.

newsData.title: بر اساس گزارش مرکز آمار ایران، تورم نقطه به نقطه در پایان خرداد باثبت نرخ ۳۹.۴درصد، به بیشترین سطح از آذرماه۱۴۰۲ رسیده است. نرخ تورم ماهانه در این‌ماه معادل ۳.۳درصد بوده که نسبت به ماه قبل افزایش ۰.۶واحد درصدی را نشان می‌دهد. نکته قابل توجه اینکه گروه خوراکی‌ها بیشترین اثرگذاری را در نرخ تورم خرداد ماه داشته است.
newsData.summary: According to the Statistical Center of Iran, point-to-point inflation at the end of June, with a rate of 39.4%, has reached its highest level since December 2023. The monthly inflation rate this month was 3.3%, which shows an increase of 0.6 percentage points compared to the previous month. It is noteworthy that the food group had the greatest impact on the inflation rate in June.

newsData.summary: Studies show that in emergency situations such as war, households with the lowest income (first and second deciles) are more vulnerable than other households.

newsData.summary: The US economy exhibits signs of 'paralysis' leading up to the release of a crucial jobs report.

newsData.title: Trump and Xi break the ice, pledge to restart talks
newsData.summary: Trump and Xi have a positive conversation and agree to resume negotiations.

newsData.title: Trump-Musk Alliance Unravels Over ‘Big Beautiful Bill’
newsData.summary: The alliance between Trump and Musk dissolves due to disagreements over the 'Big Beautiful Bill'.

newsData.title: Is Official US Economic Data Getting Less Reliable?
newsData.summary: An assessment of whether official US economic data is becoming less reliable is presented.

newsData.title: Delta warns new tariffs could force it to stop buying foreign-made airplanes
newsData.summary: Delta Air Lines cautions that new tariffs could compel the company to cease purchasing airplanes manufactured abroad.

newsData.title: Breeze Airways CEO talks consumer demand as travelers seek value
newsData.summary: The CEO of Breeze Airways discusses consumer demand as travelers prioritize value.

newsData.title: How small businesses are handling tariff uncertainty, pressures
newsData.summary: Small businesses are employing diverse strategies to navigate tariff uncertainty and related pressures.

newsData.title: The GOP's 'big, beautiful bill' would leave 10.9 million more uninsured: CBO
newsData.summary: According to the CBO, the GOP's 'big, beautiful bill' would result in 10.9 million additional uninsured individuals.

newsData.title: China's rare earth export curbs hit the auto industry worldwide
newsData.summary: China's restrictions on rare earth exports have a detrimental impact on the global auto industry.

newsData.title: Tariff uncertainty is hammering one of America's favorite food escapes — snacks
newsData.summary: Tariff uncertainty is negatively impacting the snack industry, a popular food category in America.

newsData.title: Trump’s Fight With Regulators Is About Who Watches the Watchers
newsData.summary: The focal point of Trump's conflict with regulators revolves around the issue of oversight and accountability.

newsData.title: Trump’s Tariffs Are the Highest in a Century. But After His Threats, They Seem Like a Relief.
newsData.summary: The president imposed tariffs on Japan, one of America’s closest allies, that would have been alarming just months ago. And markets went up.

newsData.title: In New Deal, Trump Keeps Tariffs While Indonesia Drops Trade Barriers
newsData.summary: The administration provided some insight into the terms that were agreed upon between Indonesia and the United States, hinting at how other vague and hastily negotiated deals may turn out.

newsData.title: Rising Inflation Underscores Risks in Trump’s New Tariff Threats
newsData.summary: New data showing price increases last month could foreshadow even higher costs if the president imposes steep tariffs on Aug. 1.

newsData.title: The Economy Has Been Resilient. The New Round of Tariffs May Hit Harder.
newsData.summary: The economy’s resilience so far to President Trump’s global trade war risks emboldening him and unleashing the sort of economic devastation that economists have long feared.

newsData.title: It’s No Bluff: The Tariff Rate Is Soaring Under Trump
newsData.summary: The president has earned a reputation for bluffing on tariffs. But he has steadily and dramatically raised U.S. tariffs, transforming global trade.

newsData.title: Under Attack by Trump’s Tariffs, Asian Countries Seek Out Better Friends
newsData.summary: Most nations are still negotiating in hopes of avoiding punitive import taxes. At the same time, they’re looking for trading partners as a way around the United States.

newsData.title: Tariffs or Deals? Trump Seems Content With Punishing Levies.
newsData.summary: The president’s supporters portray him as a top dealmaker. But, at least for now, far more trading partners have gotten stiff tariffs than trade deals.

newsData.title: As Trump Sows Tariff Confusion, Rules of Global Commerce Give Way to Chaos
newsData.summary: Blunt letters dictating terms posted to social media and changes late in negotiations have left trading partners wondering what President Trump will do next.

newsData.title: Trump Treats Tariffs More as a Form of Power Than as a Trade Tool
newsData.summary: Instead of viewing tariffs as part of a broader trade policy, President Trump sees them as a valuable weapon he can wield on the world stage.

newsData.title: As Trump Courts a More Assertive Beijing, China Hawks Are Losing Out
newsData.summary: The Trump administration has dialed back aggressive measures against China and reversed its position on technology controls as the president angles for a Chinese trip later this year.

newsData.title: Indonesia Confirms U.S. Trade Agreement, but Details Remain Scarce
newsData.summary: President Trump said the agreement would partly walk back some of the steep tariffs he threatened on the country last week. Indonesia’s president called Mr. Trump a “tough negotiator.”

newsData.title: Another Casualty in the Tariff Wars: The Always-in-Season Tomato
newsData.summary: The Trump administration is adding a 17 percent tariff to a year-round grocery store staple, while funneling more business to domestic tomato growers, largely in Florida.

newsData.title: Trump Tariffs Aim to Settle Scores With Countries, No Matter Their Size
newsData.summary: The president’s tariff announcements suggest he has not backed away from his initial strategy, where even smaller trading partners will face tariffs.

newsData.title: With Taxes and Tariffs in Place, Trump Takes Reins of U.S. Economy
newsData.summary: President Trump has achieved much of his agenda, leaving the fate of the economy squarely in his hands.

newsData.title: Trump’s New Trade Threats Set Off Global Scramble to Avoid Tariffs
newsData.summary: Many countries thought they were negotiating in good faith. The White House renewed its “reciprocal” tariff plan anyway, giving countries until Aug. 1 to make offers.

newsData.title: E.U., Mexico, Brazil: Who Has Trump Targeted With New Tariffs?
newsData.summary: President Trump has told more than two dozen countries that they will face tariffs of at least 20 percent on Aug. 1 if they don’t reach agreements by then.

newsData.title: Trump Revives Trade War, Threatening Steep Aug. 1 Tariffs on Allies
newsData.summary: President Trump said Japan and South Korea would face tariffs of 25 percent unless they reached an agreement with the United States. Other countries received notice of higher levies.

newsData.title: Trump Keeps Foreign Countries on Edge as Tariff Deadline Nears
newsData.summary: The president is again threatening higher tariff rates on a dozen foreign nations, as a deadline elapses this week for making trade deals.

newsData.title: Trump Tariff Deadline Eve Arrives as Surprises Abound
newsData.summary: Impending tariff deadline under Trump administration brings uncertainty.

newsData.summary: World leaders face critical decisions regarding trade before Trump's tariff deadline.

newsData.title: South Africa Urged to Sweeten US Trade Deal Before Tariff Deadline
newsData.summary: South Africa is encouraged to improve its trade agreement with the US to avoid tariffs.

newsData.summary: Inflation in Kenya rises, driven by increasing food prices.

newsData.summary: Bangladesh maintains its key interest rate due to uncertainties surrounding tariffs.

newsData.title: Charting the Global Economy: US Job Market Wavers in Cue for Fed
newsData.summary: US Job Market's uncertainty is preparing the stage for the Federal Reserve's action's

newsData.title: Trade Fueled Inequality. Can Trump’s Tariffs Reduce It?
newsData.summary: The president has pitched his trade policies at workers who feel left behind by globalization. But that doesn’t mean trade barriers will revive factories and close income gaps.

newsData.title: Trump, Claiming Weak Jobs Numbers Were ‘Rigged,’ Fires Labor Official
newsData.summary: Economists said ousting the head of the Bureau of Labor Statistics could undermine confidence in government economic data.

newsData.title: How Tariffs Raise Costs for Farmers, Making Food More Expensive
newsData.summary: The latest round of tariffs is likely to make agricultural production even more expensive and, potentially, limit access to goods not produced in the United States.

newsData.title: Overturning the Global Trade System, Trump Puts His Ideas to the Test
newsData.summary: President Trump has long wanted to rework world trade. The tariffs set to go into effect next week will carry out that plan.

newsData.title: Federal Government Shed 12,000 Jobs in July
newsData.summary: The U.S. government has lost 84,000 jobs since January as the Trump administration aggressively reduces the work force.

newsData.title: Big Downward Jobs Revisions Could Be a Warning Sign for the Economy
newsData.summary: Employers added far fewer jobs in May and June than previously reported. Such downgrades have historically meant trouble for the labor market.

newsData.title: Switzerland Is Stunned by 39% U.S. Tariff, Among the Highest in the World
newsData.summary: Swiss officials plan to negotiate urgently for a lower rate, before the punishing levy takes effect next week.

newsData.title: Harm or Help? Why Companies Are Battling Tariffs Meant to Benefit Them.
newsData.summary: Economists say the way the Trump administration is imposing tariffs is backfiring for some of the businesses they are meant to help.

newsData.title: Cambodia Agrees to a Reduced Tariff and Breathes a Sigh of Relief
newsData.summary: Initially 49%, it was lowered to 19%, easing worries of a damaging hit to the country’s garment and footwear production industries.

newsData.title: Countries Promise Trump to Buy U.S. Gas, and Leave the Details for Later
newsData.summary: U.S. trading partners are committing to buy more gas than they need or than the U.S. can produce, at least in the short term.

newsData.title: South Korea Reaches Trade Deal With Trump
newsData.summary: The agreement comes after other American allies, like Japan, clinched their own deals, partly to moderate President Trump’s tariff threats.

newsData.title: U.S. Imports Slid in June on Higher Tariffs
newsData.summary: Imports from other countries fell around 4 percent from the previous month as President Trump’s steep tariffs discouraged businesses from ordering goods.

newsData.title: Trump’s Demand to Trading Partners: Pledge Money or Get Higher Tariffs
newsData.summary: President Trump is using an “Art of the Deal” approach to get other nations to hand over cash to lower their tariffs.

newsData.summary: The president has pitched his trade policies at workers who feel left behind by globalization. But that doesn’t mean trade barriers will revive factories and close income gaps.

newsData.title: Trump says pharma tariffs could eventually reach 250%
newsData.summary: Trump indicates that tariffs on pharmaceuticals could potentially increase to 250%.

newsData.title: Countries scramble for deals as tariff deadline looms
newsData.summary: Nations are urgently trying to secure agreements before an impending tariff deadline.

newsData.title: Crucial exemption allows majority of Canadian and Mexican goods to be shipped to US without tariffs
newsData.summary: A key exemption enables the majority of goods from Canada and Mexico to be shipped to the US without incurring tariffs.

newsData.title: Canada Unexpectedly Sheds 40,800 Jobs, Most Since Pandemic
newsData.summary: Canada experiences a significant job loss, the largest since the pandemic.

newsData.title: Chile’s Inflation Speeds Past All Analyst Forecasts After Rate Cut
newsData.summary: Inflation in Chile rises unexpectedly after interest rate cut.

newsData.title: Romania Holds Interest Rate With Tax Hikes Set to Fuel Inflation
newsData.summary: Romania keeps interest rates steady as tax increases threaten inflation.

newsData.title: New Tariff on ‘Transshipped’ Goods Mystifies Importers
newsData.summary: The Trump administration levied a hefty tariff on goods that are moved through other countries, but it has not yet fully explained its plans.

newsData.title: Swiss Businesses Fear Being ‘Annihilated’ by One of the World’s Highest Tariffs
newsData.summary: Goods shipped from the country face a 39 percent tariff in the U.S., which companies warn will have dire consequences if President Trump cannot be quickly dissuaded.

newsData.title: Here’s What Could Get More Expensive Under Trump’s Tariffs
newsData.summary: The tariffs are driving up prices on everyday goods as businesses warn they can no longer absorb costs, leaving consumers to foot the bill.

newsData.title: Effect of U.S. Tariffs on British Companies Is ‘Milder Than Feared,’ Central Bank Says
newsData.summary: Britain’s economy is driven by domestic factors more than global ones right now, the governor of the Bank of England said on Thursday, when the central bank cut interest rates.

newsData.title: Southeast Asia Looks for Clarity From U.S. on ‘Rules of Origin’
newsData.summary: Thailand, Vietnam and other countries in the region face much higher tariffs on exports with Chinese-made components. But questions remain on how the U.S. defines a locally made product.

newsData.title: China’s Exports Surged Again in July, but Not to America
newsData.summary: China is shipping more goods to Southeast Asia and other regions that often re-export them to the United States. China still sells three times as much to the United States as it buys.

newsData.title: Staggering U.S. Tariffs Begin as Trump Widens Trade War
newsData.summary: The duties, which the president announced last week, took effect for about 90 countries just after midnight.

newsData.title: Trump to Double India’s Tariff as Punishment for Buying Russian Oil
newsData.summary: Tariffs on Indian exports to the United States will surge to 50 percent by late August, as part of an effort by President Trump to pressure Russia into resolving its war in Ukraine.

newsData.title: Why the B.L.S. Regularly Revises Jobs Data
newsData.summary: President Trump fired the head of the Bureau of Labor Statistics last week and described a jobs report that included a big downward revision as “rigged.”

newsData.summary: Imports from other countries fell around 4 percent from the previous month as President Trump’s steep tariffs discouraged businesses from ordering goods.

newsData.title: ‘A Loyalist Inside the Building’: Trump’s Temporary Fed Pick Could Have a Lasting Effect
newsData.summary: Stephen I. Miran may spend only a few months on the central bank’s board of governors, but in that time he can influence the discussions around interest rates and who will become the institution’s next leader.
